instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_LCD: What is PP3V3_S5_LCD? PP3V3_S5_LCD is a power rail that eventually powers circuitry in the LCD after going through something else. This is required for the LCD to turn on and have a nimage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no video & Backlight
threads.message:
Hi, 

I've got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, no display, no backlight. Have tested the LCD onto another machine and it is working.

Voltage measured on <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> with LCD connected.
<SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> :  3.28v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_LCD</SIGNAL> : 3.28v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL> : 0.15v
Resistance mesure at pin 2&3 with LCD : 4.62k
Resistance mesure at pin 2&3 without LCD : 81.7k

Have replaced <CHIP>U9000</CHIP> twice but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW</SIGNAL> still at 0.15v

I think LCD is being detected as testing without the LCD connected, <SIGNAL>LCD_IG_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> drops to 0v

Any advise.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - no video & Backlight
threads.message:
Do you get USB activity?

Check L9008/80.
